souffle_pancakes.name: Soufflé Pancakes
souffle_pancakes.description: Fluffy and light soufflé pancakes inspired by the movie Your Name. Perfectly soft and airy, these pancakes will melt in your mouth!
ingredients: Powdered sugar and maple syrup (for topping)
instructions: Step 1: Separate the egg yolks and whites into two bowls.
Step 2: In the yolk bowl, add milk and whisk until well combined.
Step 3: Sift in flour and baking powder, and mix until smooth.
Step 4: In the whites bowl, beat the egg whites until foamy, then gradually add sugar and continue beating until stiff peaks form.
5. Gently fold the egg whites into the yolk mixture, being careful not to deflate the batter.
6. Heat a non-stick pan over low heat and grease with butter.
7. Scoop the batter onto the pan to form small, thick pancakes. Cover with a lid and cook for a few minutes until the bottom is golden.
8. Flip the pancakes carefully, cover again, and cook the other side until golden and cooked through.
9. Serve with powdered sugar and maple syrup, and enjoy!

onigiri.name: Onigiri
onigiri.description: In Your Name, Taki, one of the main characters, eats onigiri for lunch every day. Onigiri is a rice ball stuffed with various fillings like salmon, tuna, or pickled plums. It's a simple and filling Japanese lunch option that you can easily make at home.
ingredients: Filling of your choice (pickled plums, salmon, tuna, seaweed, etc.)
instructions: Rinse the rice in cold water until the water runs clear. Drain the rice in a colander for 30 minutes to an hour.
In a large pot, combine the rice and water and bring to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook for 12-15 minutes, or until the water has been absorbed and the rice is tender.
In a small bowl, mix together the rice vinegar, sugar, and salt until the sugar and salt are dissolved.
Once the rice is cooked, transfer it to a large bowl and add the vinegar mixture. Mix gently until the rice is coated evenly with the mixture.
Wet your hands with water and sprinkle some salt on them. Take a small amount of rice and form it into a ball, about the size of a small apple.
Make a small indentation in the middle of the ball with your thumb and add a small amount of filling (pickled plums, salmon, tuna, seaweed, etc.).
Cover the filling with more rice and shape the ball into a triangle or oval shape.
Optional: wrap the onigiri with a sheet of nori and sprinkle sesame seeds on top.
Repeat the process until all the rice and filling is used up.
Serve the onigiri immediately, or store them in an airtight container in the fridge for up to a day. Enjoy!

taiyaki.name: Taiyaki
taiyaki.description: Taiyaki is a fish-shaped pastry filled with sweet red bean paste. This cute and delicious snack is perfect for satisfying your sweet tooth!
ingredients: Red bean paste or other filling of your choice
instructions: In a medium-sized mixing bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt. Mix well.
In another mixing bowl, whisk the egg, milk, and vanilla extract until well combined.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and mix until smooth.
Preheat a Taiyaki maker or a fish-shaped waffle maker on medium heat. If you don't have a Taiyaki maker, a regular waffle maker can be used.
Brush the inside of each fish-shaped mold with vegetable oil or cooking spray.
Spoon about 2 tablespoons of batter into each mold, filling it about 3/4 full.
Add a spoonful of red bean paste or other filling of your choice onto the batter.
Top with another tablespoon of batter to cover the filling.
Close the lid and cook for 2-3 minutes or until the Taiyaki is golden brown.
Carefully remove the Taiyaki from the mold and place it on a wire rack to cool.
Repeat the process until all the batter and filling is used up.
Optional: sprinkle some chocolate chips or matcha powder on top of the Taiyaki before serving.
Serve the Taiyaki warm and enjoy!

ramen.name: Naruto's Ramen
ramen.description: A delicious and authentic bowl of ramen inspired by the anime *Naruto*. This ramen is perfect for recreating the Ichiraku Ramen experience at home!
instructions: Bring the broth to a boil in a pot. Add soy sauce or miso to taste for extra flavour.
In another pot, cook the ramen noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Prepare the soft-boiled eggs by boiling them for 6-7 minutes, then placing them in ice water. Peel and slice in half.
Slice the pork belly (chashu) into thin pieces and set aside.
In a ramen bowl, place the cooked noodles, then pour the hot broth over the noodles.
Top the ramen with sliced pork belly, green onions, bamboo shoots, corn, nori sheets, and Naruto fish cake slices.
Garnish with soft-boiled egg halves and any additional toppings you prefer.
Serve hot and enjoy your Naruto-inspired ramen!

mochi.name: Mochi
mochi.description: In Spirited Away, the character No-Face is seen eating mochi, a Japanese rice cake often filled with sweet or savory fillings like red bean paste or cheese. Mochi is a popular snack enjoyed during holidays or special occasions.
ingredients: Potato starch or cornstarch for dusting
Filling of your choice (red bean paste, ice cream, etc.)
instructions: In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the glutinous rice flour, water, and sugar until smooth.
Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and microwave on high for 3 minutes.
Remove the bowl from the microwave and stir the mixture with a spatula until smooth.
Cover the bowl again and microwave on high for another 2-3 minutes.
Remove the bowl from the microwave and stir the mixture again until smooth.
Transfer the mochi mixture onto a surface dusted with potato starch or cornstarch.
Dust your hands with potato starch or cornstarch and knead the mochi until it becomes smooth and elastic.
Divide the mochi into small pieces, about 1-2 tablespoons each.
Flatten each piece of mochi with your hands, then place a small amount of filling (red bean paste, ice cream, etc.) in the center.
Fold the edges of the mochi over the filling and pinch to seal.
Roll the mochi into a ball shape, dusting with potato starch or cornstarch as needed to prevent sticking.
Repeat the process until all the mochi and filling is used up.
Serve the mochi immediately or store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to a day.
Enjoy your delicious homemade Mochi!

katsudon.name: Katsudon
katsudon.description: In My Hero Academia, Katsudon is a favourite dish of All Might and Deku. It's a comforting Japanese dish featuring a crispy pork cutlet served over rice with a savoury broth and soft-cooked eggs. Often associated with victory and success in Japanese culture, it's perfect for celebrating small wins!
instructions: Prepare the cooked white rice and set aside.
In a small skillet, heat the dashi stock, soy sauce, mirin, and sugar. Stir until the sugar is fully dissolved.
Add the sliced onions to the skillet and simmer until softened.
Place the fried pork cutlet on top of the onions.
Pour the beaten eggs evenly over the pork and onions. Cover the skillet with a lid and cook on low heat until the eggs are just set.
Serve the pork and egg mixture over a bowl of hot white rice.
Garnish with sliced green onions and enjoy!

nikuman.name: Steamed Meat Bun (Nikuman)
nikuman.description: In Haikyuu, steamed meat buns, or Nikuman, are a favourite snack for the volleyball team. These buns are soft, fluffy, and filled with a savoury meat mixture, making them the perfect post-game treat.
instructions: In a bowl, combine warm water, yeast, and sugar. Let it sit for 5-10 minutes until foamy.
Add flour, salt, and vegetable oil to the yeast mixture. Mix until a dough forms.
Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 10 minutes until smooth. Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a damp cloth, and let it rise for 1 hour or until doubled in size.
While the dough is rising, prepare the filling. In a skillet, cook ground pork with onions and garlic until the pork is browned and the onions are softened.
Add soy sauce, oyster sauce, sesame oil, sugar, and black pepper to the pork mixture. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, then remove from heat and let it cool.
After the dough has risen, punch it down and divide it into 8 equal portions. Roll each portion into a ball.
Flatten each ball into a disc and place a spoonful of the filling in the center. Wrap the dough around the filling, pinching the edges to seal, and shape it into a round bun.
Place the buns on parchment paper squares and let them rise for another 15-20 minutes.
Steam the buns in a steamer over boiling water for 10-12 minutes.
Remove from the steamer and serve warm. Enjoy your soft and savoury Nikuman!

mitarashi_dango.name: Mitarashi Dango
mitarashi_dango.description: In Demon Slayer, Mitarashi Dango is a traditional Japanese sweet enjoyed by many characters. These skewered rice dumplings are coated in a sweet and savoury soy-based glaze, making them a perfect snack for any occasion.
instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine glutinous rice flour, water, and sugar. Mix until a smooth dough forms.
Divide the dough into small, equal-sized portions and roll them into balls.
Bring a pot of water to a boil and gently drop the rice balls into the water. Cook until they float to the surface, then let them boil for an additional 1-2 minutes.
Remove the rice balls with a slotted spoon and transfer them to a bowl of cold water to cool.
Thread the cooled rice balls onto wooden skewers (about 3-4 balls per skewer).
In a small saucepan, combine soy sauce, mirin, sugar, and the cornstarch-water mixture. Heat over medium heat, stirring continuously, until the glaze thickens.
Lightly grill or pan-fry the skewered dango on all sides until slightly golden.
Brush the warm glaze over the grilled dango and serve immediately.

omurice.name: Omurice
omurice.description: Omurice, a combination of 'omelette' and 'rice,' is a beloved dish from The Way of the Househusband. This Japanese comfort food features fried rice wrapped in a fluffy omelette and topped with ketchup for a simple yet delicious meal.
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
Sauté the chopped onion until softened, then add the diced chicken and cook until warmed through.
Add the cooked white rice to the pan and stir to combine with the chicken and onions.
Season the mixture with ketchup, soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes, then remove from heat.
In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs with milk (optional) and a pinch of salt.
Heat another frying pan with a small amount of oil over low heat. Pour in the egg mixture, swirling to coat the pan evenly.
Cook the eggs gently until they are just set but still soft.
Place the fried rice mixture in the center of the omelette, then carefully fold the edges of the omelette over the rice.
Slide the omurice onto a plate, seam side down.
Garnish with ketchup and chopped parsley, then serve warm.

soba.name: Sanji's Special Soba
soba.description: Sanji's Special Soba is a dish that highlights his incredible culinary skills in *One Piece*. This simple yet delicious recipe features perfectly cooked soba noodles paired with a flavourful broth and fresh toppings.
instructions: Bring a pot of water to a boil and cook the soba noodles according to the package instructions. Drain and rinse the noodles under cold water, then set aside.
In a medium saucepan, combine the dashi stock, soy sauce, mirin, and sugar. Bring to a gentle boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 2-3 minutes.
Divide the cooked soba noodles into serving bowls.
Pour the hot broth over the noodles.
Top each bowl with sliced green onions, nori strips, halved boiled eggs, and optional tempura.
Serve immediately and enjoy Sanji's Special Soba!
